Definition: A composition represents a set of Entries sharing common provenance, a document such as an extract from a patient record, a knowledge artifact, or a catalog definition.

Short: Elements that belong to all information items.
Definition: Elements that belong to all information items.

Short: A human language, spoken or written.
Definition: A human language, spoken or written.

Short: A set of rules under which this content was created
Definition: A set of rules under which this content was created

Short: A human-readable narrative, potentially including images, that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human.
Definition: A human-readable narrative, potentially including images, that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human.

Short: A state that relates to the workflow or interpretation of this resource. Certain status values can modify the meaning of the resource, for example, entered-in-error. When a boolean value is used, Status of true indicates the record is active, false means inactive.
Definition: A state that relates to the workflow or interpretation of this resource. Certain status values can modify the meaning of the resource, for example, entered-in-error. When a boolean value is used, Status of true indicates the record is active, false means inactive.

Short: Business identifier or external id for this resource.
Definition: Business identifier or external id for this resource.

Short: A code describing the item at a greater level of detail.
Definition: A code describing the item at a greater level of detail.

Short: The general type or class of this item.
Definition: The general type or class of this item.

Short: The person or entity that the information in this resource relates to, if different than the person of record. The subject of information can be a reference or a code, the latter when the subject is described generically, for example, in terms of a relationship to the subject of record (e.g., wife).
Definition: The person or entity that the information in this resource relates to, if different than the person of record. The subject of information can be a reference or a code, the latter when the subject is described generically, for example, in terms of a relationship to the subject of record (e.g., wife).

Short: The encounter or episode of care
Definition: The encounter or episode of care

Short: The point in time when the statement was created.
Definition: The point in time when the statement was created.

Short: The actor who created the item and it responsible for the content (regardless of the information source or who recorded it). If only the author is given, it is assumed the author is the information source and the recorder.
Definition: The actor who created the item and it responsible for the content (regardless of the information source or who recorded it). If only the author is given, it is assumed the author is the information source and the recorder.

Short: A distinguishing word or group of words naming an item.
Definition: A distinguishing word or group of words naming an item.

Short: The code specifying the level of confidentiality.
Definition: The code specifying the level of confidentiality.

Short: A certification or assertion of the accuracy of the content.
Definition: A certification or assertion of the accuracy of the content.

Short: The organization that manages a patient, activity, facility, document, or service provision.
Definition: The organization that manages a patient, activity, facility, document, or service provision.

Short: Documents related to this one.
Definition: Documents related to this one.

Short: Clinical context or event being documented, for example, a colonoscopy or an appendectomy.
Definition: Clinical context or event being documented, for example, a colonoscopy or an appendectomy.

Short: The encounter or episode of care
Definition: The encounter or episode of care

Short: The main type identifier for a lab, procedure, condition, etc., usually drawn from a controlled vocabulary.
Definition: The main type identifier for a lab, procedure, condition, etc., usually drawn from a controlled vocabulary.

Short: A period of time defined by a start and end time, date, or year.
Definition:
A period of time defined by a start and end time, date, or year.
If the start date/time is missing, the start of the period is not known. If the end date/time is missing, it means that the period is ongoing.

Short: Kind of facility where patient was seen
Definition: Kind of facility where patient was seen

Short: Description of the place or type of surroundings where something is positioned or where an event takes place.
Definition: Description of the place or type of surroundings where something is positioned or where an event takes place.

Short: A person in the role of a patient. Sometimes, the patient is not the subject of information in a clinical statement where the Patient is the SubjectOfRecord.
Definition:
A person in the role of a patient. Sometimes, the patient is not the subject of information in a clinical statement where the Patient is the SubjectOfRecord.

SHR follows Argonaut and makes the value set binding on marital status required. MaritalStatus has a required binding in Argonaut, but an extensible binding in US-Core. To be feasible under both DSTU2 Argonaut and STU3 US-Core, the required binding strength is adopted.

Short: Additional information to support this request.
Definition: Additional information to support this request.

Short: Represents a section containing entries in a composition.
Definition: Represents a section containing entries in a composition.
